p: A second lineage, known as West African (WA), was retrospectively identified in mosquitoes captured in Senegal [ 3]. Then, the virus is thought to have moved from Africa to Asia, where CHIKV outbreaks were initially confused with dengue epidemics. Genetic analyses of CHIKV isolated from 1958 to 1973 in Asia placed them in a distinct group called the Asian lineage [ 3, 4]. More recently (2004), a phylogenetic group, the Indian Ocean sub Lineage (IOL), originated from an ECSA clade causing, among others, a large epidemic in RÃ©union Island in 2005 [ 5].
